__e: Helen and I think it would be best for Sarah to spend the summer with us.
I know what's happened, Helen, and I must speak with you.
And since he can't suffer, Helen did, and now so will you.
Yes, darling. I'll be with you tomorrow.
Please, Helen, there's so much more I want to say.
Well, Helen... I don't know what to say.
You know, you need to figure out what kind of a relationship you want.
Helen, you let the damn kid do whatever he wants.
If you think Helen's here to help, then you're madder than she is.
-She won't be. I just talked to Liza. We can push it up.
Helen is where she's supposed to be.
Helen never cared about either of us.
I'm sure Helen told you that I didn't know him very well.
The way Helen spoke to the man I saw was casual, as if she'd met him before.
Helen, I've been living with this kind of thing my whole life.
But I tell you. Coming from Helen, it seems...
